page.title: 11GLOSSOPDALE HOUSING
page.content: In this 'D-block' 4.5sq.km. is agricultural land, the rest is mainly covered with housing, factories and houses being built close to each other. The older houses are built of{ {local gritstone},{brick}being used for a small number of houses built before 1930 and for almost all those built after 1945. The farm houses and terraced houses are the oldest types in the area, semi-detached and detach- ed coming later. The newer houses, private and council, have been built in estates and in recent years mainly the former have been built. The newest developments have been in Hadfield, Charlesworth,& Simmondley (1980-85) There are few bungalows, for not many old people move into the area to live. The farm buildings show the importance of this work in the past. Today many travel to work in Manchester by rail.
